intro: Pseudocodon graminifolius, commonly known as the grass-leaved pseudocodon, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
